Latent Bestial Fury.name: Latent Bestial Fury
Latent Bestial Fury.description: Beginning at 11th level, you have advantage on initiative checks. If you already have advantage on the check, you instead gain a +5 bonus to the result

Latent Blood of The Dragon.name: Latent Blood of The Dragon
Latent Blood of The Dragon.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you have grown close to your latent dragonic nature affinity. Select one nature release. All Ryu clan jutsu you learn or cast gain the chosen keyword. This cannot be changed.

Latent Blood of the Earth I.name: Latent Blood of the Earth I
Latent Blood of the Earth I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, when you are wearing Light or Medium Armor you can use Intelligence in place of Dexterity for your Armor Class and you ignore difficult terrain while you are on solid land.

Latent Blood of the Earth II.name: Latent Blood of the Earth II
Latent Blood of the Earth II.description:
(You must have Latent Blood of the Earth I)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain 30 feet of tremor sense

Latent Blood of the Leaf.name: Latent Blood of the Leaf
Latent Blood of the Leaf.description: Beginning at 15th level, When you would make a charisma check to intimidate or persuade a hostile or unfriendly creature, you can use constitution in place of charisma.

Latent Blood Pact.name: Latent Blood Pact
Latent Blood Pact.description:
(You must have Latent Ketsuryūgan I and Latent Sanguine Prowess I)

Beginning at 11th level, you gain the Blood Pact feature of the Chinoike clan up to 7th level. This feature instead persists until either you and your Patron complete a long rest.

Latent Boil Over I.name: Latent Boil Over I
Latent Boil Over I.description: Beginning at 1st level, Futton Clan Hijutsu you cast that doesn't add your ability modifier to damage, gains a +1 bonus to damage

Latent Boil Over II.name: Latent Boil Over II
Latent Boil Over II.description:
(You must have Latent Boil Over I)

Beginning at 7th level, Futton Clan Hijutsu you cast that doesn't add your ability modifier to damage, gains a +2 bonus to damage.

Latent Boil Over III.name: Latent Boil Over III
Latent Boil Over III.description:
(You must have Latent Boil Over II)

Beginning at 15th level, Futton Clan Hijutsu you cast that doesn't add your ability modifier to damage, gains a +4 bonus to damage.

Latent Boil Release I.name: Latent Boil Release I
Latent Boil Release I.description: Beginning at 3rd level if you would cast a jutsu with the Water Release or Fire Release keywords, you can deal bonus 1d4 acid damage to corroded creatures, once per turn.

Latent Boil Release II.name: Latent Boil Release II
Latent Boil Release II.description:
(You must have Latent Boil Release I)

Beginning at 15th level, Acid damage you deal pierces damage reduction twice per rest.

Latent Boiling Body.name: Latent Boiling Body
Latent Boiling Body.description:
(You must have Latent Boiling Chakra I)

Beginning at 7th level, as an Action, spend a number of boil points up to the number of boil points you have left. When you do, you can increase you Strength or Dexterity score by 2 for each point spent, until the end of your next turn. You cannot select this feature if you have Latent Boiling Mind or Latent Boiling Determination.

Latent Boiling Chakra I.name: Latent Boiling Chakra I
Latent Boiling Chakra I.description: Beginning at 7th level, You gain 2 Boil points, which you can spend on either Latent Boiling Body, Latent Boiling Mind, Latent Boiling Determination

Latent Boiling Chakra II.name: Latent Boiling Chakra II
Latent Boiling Chakra II.description:
(You must have Latent Boiling Chakra I)

Beginning at 15th level, You gain 3 additional Boil Points.

Latent Boiling Determination.name: Latent Boiling Determination
Latent Boiling Determination.description:
(You must have Latent Boiling Chakra I)

Beginning at 3rd level, you can spend 1 boil point to increase Futton Clan Hijutsu you casts damage by 1d6 until the end of the current turn . You cannot select this feature if you have Latent Boiling Body or Latent Boiling Mind.

Latent Boiling Mind.name: Latent Boiling Mind
Latent Boiling Mind.description:
(You must have Latent Boiling Chakra I)

Beginning at 7th level, when you would jutsu that deals Acid Damage. you can spend a number of boil points to choose a creature for each boil point spent, making them immune to the jutsu's effects until the end of the current turn. You cannot select this feature if you have Latent Boiling Body or Latent Boiling Determination.

Latent Bone Weapons I.name: Latent Bone Weapons I
Latent Bone Weapons I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, select one type of simple weapon. As a bonus action you can conjure this weapon and it is treated as a Bone weapon for you. Additionally, choose between the following weapon properties; Critical, Light and Finesse. Your chosen bone weapon gains the chosen property.

Latent Bone Weapons II.name: Latent Bone Weapons II
Latent Bone Weapons II.description:
(You must have Latent Bone Weapons I)

Beginning at 7th level, your bone weapons damage die increases by one step.

Latent Bone Weapons III.name: Latent Bone Weapons III
Latent Bone Weapons III.description:
(You must have Latent Bone Weapons II)

Beginning at 11th level, you can select one Martial weapon with which you can create as a Bone weapon

Latent Branch Family.name: Latent Branch Family
Latent Branch Family.description: Being born with only a fraction of the Hyūga blood, you are treated as a Side Branch. If/When you would learn Hyūga clan Hijutsu, you can only learn jutsu with the Side Branch Keyword.

Latent Branch Style.name: Latent Branch Style
Latent Branch Style.description: Beginning at 1st level, you gain the Reckless Style. If you can learn Bakuton Hijutsu, you can learn jutsu with the chosen style keyword.

Latent Brute Strength I.name: Latent Brute Strength I
Latent Brute Strength I.description: You gain proficiency in weapons with the Versatile property. Beginning at 7th level, you always add at least half of your Strength modifier to damage rolls of weapon attacks, even if you could not normally.

Latent Brute Strength II.name: Latent Brute Strength II
Latent Brute Strength II.description:
(You must have Latent Brute Strength I)

Beginning at 11th level, you instead add your full strength modifier instead of half

Latent Bug Host I.name: Latent Bug Host I
Latent Bug Host I.description: Beginning at 1st level, twice per long rest, you can add 1d4 to any constitution saving throw.

Latent Bug Host II.name: Latent Bug Host II
Latent Bug Host II.description:
(You must have Latent Bug Host I)

Beginning at 7th level, the bonus increases to a d6.

Latent Byakugan I.name: Latent Byakugan I
Latent Byakugan I.description:
(You must have Latent Branch Family)

Beginning at 3rd Level, you can spend 10 chakra to activate your latent Byakugan. It remains active for up to 10 minutes. You may activate and deactivate the Byakugan during this time period with no additional cost. While active you gain 120 feet of Chakra sight while out of combat and 60 feet of chakra sight while in combat. You can see through material up to 5 feet thick. Creatures cannot be obscured to you in any way if you can see through the obstruction. Also, you can see 360 degrees around you without having to turn your head or avert your eyes.

Latent Byakugan II.name: Latent Byakugan II
Latent Byakugan II.description:
(You must have Latent Byakugan I)

Beginning at 7th level, Select one of the following benefits from the list provided under the Byakugan clan feature. If you choose Immense Distance, your chakra sight range is doubled to 240 feet and you can see things up to half a mile away as if they were within 50- feet of you.

Latent Byakugan III.name: Latent Byakugan III
Latent Byakugan III.description:
(You must have Latent Byakugan II)

Beginning at 15th level, Select one of the following benefits from the list provided under the Byakugan clan feature, that you have not selected yet. If you choose Immense Distance, your chakra sight range is doubled to 240 feet and you can see things up to half a mile away as if they were within 50- feet of you.

Latent Byakugan IV.name: Latent Byakugan IV
Latent Byakugan IV.description:
(You must have Latent Byakugan III)

Beginning at 18th level, Select one of the following benefits from the list provided under the Byakugan clan feature, that you have not selected yet. If you choose Immense Distance, your chakra sight range is doubled to 240 feet and you can see things up to half a mile away as if they were within 50- feet of you

Latent Calcified Skin I.name: Latent Calcified Skin I
Latent Calcified Skin I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, while wearing no armor or light armor, you reduce all incoming bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage by -2.

Latent Calcified Skin II.name: Latent Calcified Skin II
Latent Calcified Skin II.description:
(You must have Latent Calcified Skin I)

Beginning at 15th level, the damage reduction increases to -5.

Latent Calcified Structure.name: Latent Calcified Structure
Latent Calcified Structure.description: Beginning at 11th level, when you would make a saving throw against a jutsu with the medical keyword, you gain a 1d6 bonus to the result.

Latent Calories I.name: Latent Calories I
Latent Calories I.description: Beginning at 1st level, you gain a number of calories equal to your level, up to a maximum of 5. If you have less than 5 calories total, each time you gain a level you gain +1 Calorie, until you reach a maximum of 5. You regain spent calories when you complete a long rest.

Latent Calories II.name: Latent Calories II
Latent Calories II.description:
(You must have Latent Calories I)

Increase the maximum number of calories you can have to 10.

Latent Cataclysmic I.name: Latent Cataclysmic I
Latent Cataclysmic I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you can deal double damage to structures, constructs and objects.

Latent Cataclysmic II.name: Latent Cataclysmic II
Latent Cataclysmic II.description:
(You must have Latent Cataclysmic I)

Beginning at 11th level, you can deal triple damage to structures, constructs and objects.

Latent Chakra Consumption I.name: Latent Chakra Consumption I
Latent Chakra Consumption I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, when you would cast an Aburame Clan Hijutsu, that deals damage, you can choose to instead reduce its damage by half and deal Chakra damage instead.

Latent Chakra Consumption II.name: Latent Chakra Consumption II
Latent Chakra Consumption II.description:
(You must have Latent Chakra Consumption I)

Beginning at 11th level, when you would deal Chakra damage to a creature using your Aburame clan Hijutsu, you can choose to gain temporary chakra points equal to your proficiency bonus.

Latent Chakra Reserves I.name: Latent Chakra Reserves I
Latent Chakra Reserves I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you learn to manifest a pool of Latent Reserve Cells. You gain a number of Reserve Cells equal to your level, up to a maximum of 5 Reserve Cells which can only be spent as a Bonus action on your turn, to regain 1d6 chakra points per cell spent

Latent Chakra Reserves II.name: Latent Chakra Reserves II
Latent Chakra Reserves II.description:
(You must have Latent Chakra Reserves I)

Beginning at 11th level, your maximum number of Reserve Cells increases to 10.

Latent Chakra Sense I.name: Latent Chakra Sense I
Latent Chakra Sense I.description: Beginning at 1st level, by spending 1 minute, you can sense creatures that can utilize chakra within 500 feet of you, and what direction they are in.

Latent Chakra Sense II.name: Latent Chakra Sense II
Latent Chakra Sense II.description:
(You must have Latent Chakra Sense I)

Beginning at 11th level, The range increases to 1 mile.

Latent Charming Persona.name: Latent Charming Persona
Latent Charming Persona.description: Beginning at 1st level, you may cast Vesper Clan Genjutsu using Charisma instead of Wisdom

Latent Chilled Body I.name: Latent Chilled Body I
Latent Chilled Body I.description: Beginning at 7th level, you gain resistance to cold damage.

Latent Chilled Body II.name: Latent Chilled Body II
Latent Chilled Body II.description:
(You must have Latent Chilled Body I)

Beginning at 15th level, You gain immunity to cold damage.

Latent Churning Magma I.name: Latent Churning Magma I
Latent Churning Magma I.description: Beginning at 7th level, fire damage you deal, deals 1d4 additional damage.

Latent Churning Magma II.name: Latent Churning Magma II
Latent Churning Magma II.description:
(You must have Latent Churning Magma I)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain the 11th level Churning Magma clan feature.

Latent Combat Medicine I.name: Latent Combat Medicine I
Latent Combat Medicine I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, when you cast a Taijutsu or use take the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge actions, you can cast one jutsu with the Medical keyword with the casting time of one action that provides hit points, temporary hit points, damage reduction, or a provides a boost or boon, as part of the same action. You may do this once per long rest.

Latent Combat Medicine II.name: Latent Combat Medicine II
Latent Combat Medicine II.description:
(You must have Latent Combat Medicine I)

At 7th level, you may use your Latent Combat Medicine feature an additional time per long rest, and regain one use of this feature on a short rest.

Latent Commander of the Deep.name: Latent Commander of the Deep
Latent Commander of the Deep.description: You can communicate with beasts that can breathe water. Beginning at 11th level, you learn the Summoning Technique D-Rank ninjutsu with a contract with the Shark tribe. You can cast this jutsu ignoring Ability Score Requirements. They are also summoned in a large bubble of Water that they use for land travel. If they ever end their turns more than 60 feet away from you and they are not in a body of water that is not the bubble, they are automatically unsummoned.

Latent Concussive Blasts I.name: Latent Concussive Blasts I
Latent Concussive Blasts I.description: Beginning at 7th level, Bakuton Clan Hijutsu, you cast adds half of your proficiency bonus to damage, once per casting.

Latent Concussive Blasts II.name: Latent Concussive Blasts II
Latent Concussive Blasts II.description:
(You must have Latent Concussive Blasts I)

Beginning at 11th level, when you would cast a Bakuton clan Hijutsu that affects an area, you can spend Chakra die, increasing the damage dealt by the result of the chakra die.

Latent Concussive Blasts III.name: Latent Concussive Blasts III
Latent Concussive Blasts III.description:
(You must have Latent Concussive Blasts II)

Beginning at 18th level, when you would spend a Chakra die as a result of Latent Concussive Blasts II, you can also choose a creature for each chakra die spent, making them immune to the jutsu's effects until the end of the current turn.

Latent Coordinate I.name: Latent Coordinate I
Latent Coordinate I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, as an action, you can make an Intelligence check DC 12 + 1 for each ally you are targeting. On a success, you provide a +1 bonus to their attack rolls and skill checks. This bonus lasts for 2 of your turns. You can coordinate one per long rest.

Latent Coordinate II.name: Latent Coordinate II
Latent Coordinate II.description:
(You must have Latent Coordinate I)

Your coordinate bonus now also applied to saving throws.

Latent Coordinate III.name: Latent Coordinate III
Latent Coordinate III.description:
(You must have Latent Coordinate II)

Beginning at 11th level, the bonus increases to a +3.

Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode I.name: Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode I
Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode I.description:
(You must have Latent Designated Existence)

Beginning at 7th level, you can enter your Corrupted Chakra Mode. Entering this form costs an action and you can enter this form once per long rest for 1 minute. While in this form, you gain all the abilities of the Corrupted Chakra Mode clan feature as if you were 3rd level.

Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode II.name: Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode II
Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode II.description:
(You must have Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode I)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain the benefits of Corrupted Chakra Mode as if you were 7th level.

Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode III.name: Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode III
Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode III.description:
(You must have Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode II)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain an additional use of your Corrupted Chakra Mode per long rest.

Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode IV.name: Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode IV
Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode IV.description:
(You must have Latent Corrupted Chakra Mode III)

Beginning at 18th level, you gain the benefits of Corrupted Chakra Mode as if you were 15th level.

Latent Crystalized Focus I.name: Latent Crystalized Focus I
Latent Crystalized Focus I.description: Beginning at 11th level, you gain 2 Crystallization die. These die can be spent when you would deal damage with a ninjutsu with the earth release keyword, adding the die to the damage result OR when you would reduce damage with a ninjutsu with the earth release keyword, adding up to 1 die to the damage reduction result. Spent die are refreshed when you would complete a long rest.

Latent Crystalized Focus II.name: Latent Crystalized Focus II
Latent Crystalized Focus II.description:
(You must have Latent Crystalized Focus I)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain 1 additional Crystallization die.

Latent Crystalized Focus III.name: Latent Crystalized Focus III
Latent Crystalized Focus III.description:
(You must have Latent Crystalized Focus II)

Beginning at 18th level, you gain 1 additional Crystallization die

Latent Crystalline Stone I.name: Latent Crystalline Stone I
Latent Crystalline Stone I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, Ninjutsu you cast that produces Quake Shards reduces all incoming damage to the construct by -2.

Latent Crystalline Stone II.name: Latent Crystalline Stone II
Latent Crystalline Stone II.description:
(You must have Latent Crystalline Stone I)

Beginning at 15rd level, the reduction transforms and becomes resistance.

Latent Cunning Genjutsu.name: Latent Cunning Genjutsu
Latent Cunning Genjutsu.description: Beginning at 3rd level you master the technical applications of Kashu Hijutsu. You may use Intelligence in place of Wisdom for the Attack and Damage rolls, and Save DC of Kashu Hijutsu you cast.

Latent Data Channels I.name: Latent Data Channels I
Latent Data Channels I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you gain 1 Data Channel of your choice

Latent Data Channels II.name: Latent Data Channels II
Latent Data Channels II.description:
(You must have Latent Data Channels I)

Beginning at 11th level, you gain 1 Data Channel of your choice.

Latent Data Channels III.name: Latent Data Channels III
Latent Data Channels III.description:
(You must have Latent Data Channels II)

Beginning at 18th level, you gain 2 Data Channels of your choice.

Latent Data Release I.name: Latent Data Release I
Latent Data Release I.description: Beginning at 7th level, when you cast a jutsu with the Lightning Release keyword, you can change the damage type to force, increase the damage dealt by 1 step.

Latent Data Release II.name: Latent Data Release II
Latent Data Release II.description:
(You must have Latent Data Release I)

Beginning at 15th level, once per long rest, when you use your Data Release I feature, you can perform a Data Leak on one affected creature, learning two of the following pieces of information as listed in the Genwa Data Release feature.

Latent Designated Existence.name: Latent Designated Existence
Latent Designated Existence.description: Beginning at 1st level, you can understand and communicate in "Snake Speech" and gain proficiency in Perception and Survival.

Latent Dimension Walker.name: Latent Dimension Walker
Latent Dimension Walker.description: Beginning at 1st level, you gain the ability to communicate with machines

Latent Disorientation I.name: Latent Disorientation I
Latent Disorientation I.description: You gain the Disorientation Clan feature at 1st level

Latent Disorientation II.name: Latent Disorientation II
Latent Disorientation II.description: (You must have Latent Disorientation I) Beginning at 15th level, the save DC to remove ranks of Disorientation increases to 20. Additionally, twice per long rest, when a creature fails a saving throw against a Genjutsu you cast, you can give them 1 rank of Disorientation.

Latent Divine Shikigami.name: Latent Divine Shikigami
Latent Divine Shikigami.description: Beginning at 15th level, You gain the Divine Shikigami clan feature.

Latent Dragon Claws I.name: Latent Dragon Claws I
Latent Dragon Claws I.description: (You must have Latent Blood of the Dragon) Beginning at 3rd level, unarmed attacks you make become chakra enhanced and deals the same damage as your chosen Nature release. Your unarmed damage becomes a d4

Latent Dragon Claws II.name: Latent Dragon Claws II
Latent Dragon Claws II.description:
(You must have Latent Dragon Claws I)

Beginning at 7th level, your unarmed damage die becomes a d6.

Latent Dragon Claws III.name: Latent Dragon Claws III
Latent Dragon Claws III.description:
(You must have Latent Dragon Claws II)

Beginning at 15th level, your unarmed damage die becomes a d8.

Latent Dragon's Rage I.name: Latent Dragon's Rage I
Latent Dragon's Rage I.description:
(You must have Latent Blood of the Dragon & Latent Dragon Claws I)

Beginning at 7th level, you can as an Action, enter your Dragons Rage state. This transformation lasts for 1 minute and cannot be ended early. For the duration, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC and can make unarmed attacks with Dragon Claws using Constitution in place of Strength. You can do this once every 10 minutes.

Latent Dragon's Rage II.name: Latent Dragon's Rage II
Latent Dragon's Rage II.description:
(You must have Latent Dragon's Rage I)

Beginning at 11th level, while in Dragon's Rage, your speed increases by 5 feet.

Latent Dragon's Rage III.name: Latent Dragon's Rage III
Latent Dragon's Rage III.description:
(You must have Latent Dragon's Rage II)

Beginning at 11th level, while in Dragon's Rage, you gain Resistance to your chosen nature release's damage type.

Latent Dragon's Rage IV.name: Latent Dragon's Rage IV
Latent Dragon's Rage IV.description:
(You must have Latent Dragon's Rage III)

Beginning at 11th level, while in your Dragon's Rage transformation, your Claw's damage die increases by +1, twice per turn.

Latent Dragon's Rage V.name: Latent Dragon's Rage V
Latent Dragon's Rage V.description:
(You must have Latent Dragon's Rage IV)

Beginning at 15th level, your bonus to AC increases to +2.

Latent Dragon's Rage VI.name: Latent Dragon's Rage VI
Latent Dragon's Rage VI.description:
(You must have Latent Dragon's Rage V)

Beginning at 18th level, while within your Dragon's Rage transformation, your Claw attack damage die now increases by +2, twice per turn.

Latent Draining Seals I.name: Latent Draining Seals I
Latent Draining Seals I.description: Beginning at 7th level, when a creature fails a saving throw against a Ninjutsu with the Fuinjutsu keyword, they take chakra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

Latent Draining Seals II.name: Latent Draining Seals II
Latent Draining Seals II.description:
(You must have Latent Draining Seals I)

Beginning at 15th level, the chakra damage increases to twice your proficiency bonus.

Latent Dust Layer I.name: Latent Dust Layer I
Latent Dust Layer I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, the first time each turn you deal earth damage with a Jiton Hijutsu you cast, the affected creature suffers a -1 penalty to skill checks until the end of your next turn. This penalty does not stack.

Latent Dust Layer II.name: Latent Dust Layer II
Latent Dust Layer II.description:
(You must have Latent Dust Layer I)

Beginning at 7th level, the penalty now applies to Dexterity saving throws.

Latent Dust Layer III.name: Latent Dust Layer III
Latent Dust Layer III.description:
(You must have Latent Dust Layer II)

Beginning at 15th level, the penalty now stacks up to 2 times and each application resets its duration.

Latent Empowered Healing I.name: Latent Empowered Healing I
Latent Empowered Healing I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, twice per long rest when you would cast a jutsu with the Medical keyword that provides hit points, temporary hit points, damage reduction, or a provides a boost or boon, you can remove all ranks of any one condition affecting one target creature as if you used the Restorative Ninjutsu at your highest known jutsu rank.

Latent Empowered Healing II.name: Latent Empowered Healing II
Latent Empowered Healing II.description:
(You must have Latent Empowered Healing I)

Beginning at 11th level, alternatively, if you use this feature with a jutsu with the Medical keyword that removes conditions, you can spend a use of this feature to make the target immune to gaining one of the conditions removed again, from a hostile source, for the next minute.

Latent Energy Overflow I.name: Latent Energy Overflow I
Latent Energy Overflow I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, each time you would take damage that is not self-inflicted or cast a jutsu with the Fire or Lightning Release keywords, you gain an Energy Die at the start of your next turn, which are d4s. Whenever you cast a jutsu with the Fire or Lightning Release keywords, you can spend any number of Energy Die, adding it to the damage roll. When you use Energy Die this way, your jutsu creates dim light for a number of feet equal to the distance your jutsu traveled, until the end of the turn. You can hold a maximum amount of Energy Die equal to half your proficiency bonus, rounded down.

Latent Energy Overflow II.name: Latent Energy Overflow II
Latent Energy Overflow II.description:
(You must have Latent Energy Overflow I)

Beginning at 11th level, your Energy Die becomes a d6 and the light you create from jutsu cast when spending an Energy Die becomes bright light instead of dim light.

Latent Energy Overflow III.name: Latent Energy Overflow III
Latent Energy Overflow III.description:
(You must have Latent Energy Overflow II)

Beginning at 18th level, your Energy Die becomes a d8. When you would use an Energy Die on a Keton Hijutsu, you ignore resistance to fire damage and treats immunity as resistance

Latent Enlightening Grasp I.name: Latent Enlightening Grasp I
Latent Enlightening Grasp I.description: Beginning at 1st level, as an action, you can place your palm on an object, that's not being held or worn by a hostile creature, no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. For the next 10 minutes, the object sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can spend 5 chakra to increase the duration of this feature on an object effected from 10 minutes to 1 hour. You can dismiss the light from as many objects you have affected as an action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus per long rest.

Latent Enlightening Grasp II.name: Latent Enlightening Grasp II
Latent Enlightening Grasp II.description:
(You must have Latent Enlightening Grasp I)

You can now target objects being held or worn. If you target an object being held or worn by a hostile creature, the creature must succeed a Dexterity saving throw vs. your Ninjutsu Save DC to avoid this feature. This feature's uses per long rest are now equal to your proficiency bonus. You can spend 5 chakra (no action required) to gain an additional number of uses equal to half your proficiency bonus.

Latent Enthralling Strength I.name: Latent Enthralling Strength I
Latent Enthralling Strength I.description:
(You must have Latent Superior Being I)

Beginning at 11th level, creatures charmed by your Vesper Hijutsu make their next check or saving throw to end the condition at disadvantage.

Latent Enthralling Strength II.name: Latent Enthralling Strength II
Latent Enthralling Strength II.description:
(You must have Latent Enthralling Strength I)

Beginning at 11th level, once per rest when a creature would fail a saving throw against a Genjutsu you cast, you can automatically charm the target. A Creature charmed this way does not stop being charmed the first time you would damage them after charming them this way.

Latent Exoskeleton I.name: Latent Exoskeleton I
Latent Exoskeleton I.description: Beginning at 7th level, one per rest, as an action, you can conjure a thick coat of golden armor. You gain 5 temporary hit points at the beginning of each of your turns for 1 minute.

Latent Exoskeleton II.name: Latent Exoskeleton II
Latent Exoskeleton II.description:
(You must have Latent Exoskeleton I)

Beginning at 15th level, the amount of temporary hit points you gain increases to 10 at the beginning of each of your turns for 1 minute.

Latent Fat Insulation I.name: Latent Fat Insulation I
Latent Fat Insulation I.description: Beginning at 15th level, as an action, you can spend convert 6 calories to end either the Shocked or Chilled conditions.

Latent Food Conversion II.name: Latent Food Conversion II
Latent Food Conversion II.description:
(You must have Latent Food Insolation I)

You can spend your calories in this way, as a Bonus Action

Latent Food Pill I.name: Latent Food Pill I
Latent Food Pill I.description: Beginning at 7th level, As a bonus action, you can take the Green Spinach Pill. When you do, you lose 2 calories and gain a +4 bonus to Strength and temporary hit points equal to your level for 1 minute. After 1 minute, you gain 2 ranks of weakened until you complete your next rest.

Latent Food Pill II.name: Latent Food Pill II
Latent Food Pill II.description:
(You must have Latent Food Pill I)

Beginning at 11th level, you can take the Yellow Curry Pill as a bonus action. When you do, you lose 3 calories. You deal an additional 1d4 damage with unarmed and Taijutsu attacks for 1 minute. After 1, minute, you gain 2 ranks of exhaustion.

Latent Food Pill III.name: Latent Food Pill III
Latent Food Pill III.description:
(You must have Latent Food Pill II)

Beginning at 15th level, you can take the Red Chili Pill as a bonus action. When you do, you lose 5 calories. You increase all damage die of unarmed attacks and Taijutsu you cast by 1 step for 1 minute. After 1 minute you fall unconscious for 1 hour.

Latent Forceful Gale I.name: Latent Forceful Gale I
Latent Forceful Gale I.description: Beginning at 7th level, Ninjutsu you cast with the Wind Release Keyword disperses vapors, gases, and fogs that can be dispersed by strong winds.

Latent Forceful Gale II.name: Latent Forceful Gale II
Latent Forceful Gale II.description:
(You must have Latent Forceful Gale I)

Beginning at 7th level, your wind damage ignores resistance.

Latent Frigid Cold I.name: Latent Frigid Cold I
Latent Frigid Cold I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, when you would attempt to water walk you create a 5 by 5 patch of ice that you can walk on that counts as difficult terrain for everyone excluding yourself

Latent Frigid Cold II.name: Latent Frigid Cold II
Latent Frigid Cold II.description:
(You must have Latent Frigid Cold I)

Beginning at 11th level, for every two ranks of the chilled condition a creature has as the result of a jutsu or feature you used, they suffer a 1d4 penalty to damage rolls that rely on Dexterity.

Latent Frigid Cold III.name: Latent Frigid Cold III
Latent Frigid Cold III.description:
(You must have Latent Frigid Cold II)

Beginning at 15th level, the inflicted penalty now also applied to attack rolls that rely on Dexterity as well.

Latent Fuinjutsu Master I.name: Latent Fuinjutsu Master I
Latent Fuinjutsu Master I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, once per rest, you can cast a jutsu with the Fuinjutsu keyword as a bonus action.

Latent Fuinjutsu Master II.name: Latent Fuinjutsu Master II
Latent Fuinjutsu Master II.description:
(You must have Latent Fuinjutsu Master I)

Beginning at 11th level, you can cast a jutsu with the Fuinjutsu keyword as a bonus action twice per rest.

Latent Fundamental Difference I.name: Latent Fundamental Difference I
Latent Fundamental Difference I.description: Beginning at 7th level, you may use Constitution in place of Intelligence for Ninjutsu you cast with the Fuinjutsu keyword.

Latent Galvanation.name: Latent Galvanation
Latent Galvanation.description:
(You must have Latent Twin Style)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain the Galvanation clan feature.

Latent Genjutsu Resilience.name: Latent Genjutsu Resilience
Latent Genjutsu Resilience.description:
(You must have Latent Superior Being I)

Beginning at 7th level, you gain a +2 bonus to saving throws against Genjutsu with the Visual keyword.

Latent Genjutsu Specialty I.name: Latent Genjutsu Specialty I
Latent Genjutsu Specialty I.description: Beginning at 3rd level reduce the cost of Genjutsu that is D-Rank or Higher that requires concentration by 1

Latent Genjutsu Specialty II.name: Latent Genjutsu Specialty II
Latent Genjutsu Specialty II.description:
(You must have Latent Genjutsu Specialty I)

Beginning at 11th level, you instead reduce the cost to concentrate on Genjutsu by an amount equal to its rank; (D-Rank: 1, C-Rank: 2, B-Rank: 3, A-Rank: 4, S-Rank: 5.)

Latent Gentle Fist I.name: Latent Gentle Fist I
Latent Gentle Fist I.description:
(You must have Latent Branch Family & Latent Byakugan I)

Beginning at 3rd level, you have been taught how to fight with the Hyuga's legendary Gentle fist stance. You can roll a d6, in place of your normal unarmed damage die. Additionally, your unarmed attacks deal Chakra damage. If targeting an undead or construct you treat them as if they have resistance to your unarmed attacks while in this stance.

Latent Gentle Fist II.name: Latent Gentle Fist II
Latent Gentle Fist II.description:
You must have Latent Gentle Fist I)

When a creature you deal chakra too with your unarmed attacks has 0 chakra, you instead deal 1.5x the damage result as force damage to the creatures hit points.

Latent Gentle Fist III.name: Latent Gentle Fist III
Latent Gentle Fist III.description:
(You must have Latent Gentle Fist II)

Beginning at 11th level, Your Gentle Fist unarmed damage becomes 2d6.

Latent Gentle Fist IV.name: Latent Gentle Fist IV
Latent Gentle Fist IV.description:
(You must have Latent Gentle Fist III)

Beginning at 18th level, Your Gentle Fist unarmed damage becomes 3d6.

Latent Go with the Flow I.name: Latent Go with the Flow I
Latent Go with the Flow I.description: Beginning at 1st level, when you cast a Ninjutsu with the Wind Release keyword, you ignore half cover.

Latent Go with the Flow II.name: Latent Go with the Flow II
Latent Go with the Flow II.description:
(You must have Latent Go with the Flow I)

Beginning at 1st level, you reduce falling damage by half as the wind naturally protects you.

Latent Go with the Flow III.name: Latent Go with the Flow III
Latent Go with the Flow III.description:
(You must have Latent Go with the Flow II)

Beginning at 11th level, you now ignore 3/4th's cover when you cast a Ninjutsu with the Wind Release keyword.

Latent Hanami Boons.name: Latent Hanami Boons
Latent Hanami Boons.description: Beginning at 7th level, select two of the listed Hanami Boons from the Hanami Clan. You gain access to these boons, and may use them as specified within the Hanami Boons Clan Feature. You can use this feature twice per long rest.

Latent Hardened Body, Hardened Mind.name: Latent Hardened Body, Hardened Mind
Latent Hardened Body, Hardened Mind.description: Beginning at 15th level, twice per long rest you may make a Strength saving throw in place of a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw imposed against you. Alternatively, you may spend a use of this feature to make a Wisdom saving throw in place of an Intelligence or Charisma saving throw imposed against you.

Latent Ice Release I.name: Latent Ice Release I
Latent Ice Release I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, jutsu you cast with the Wind Release or Water Release deals +3 additional damage to creatures with the chilled condition, once per casting.

Latent Ice Release II.name: Latent Ice Release II
Latent Ice Release II.description:
(You must have Latent Ice Release I)

Beginning at 15th level, the bonus damage increases to +5.

Latent Ice Release III.name: Latent Ice Release III
Latent Ice Release III.description:
(You must have Latent Ice Release II)

Beginning at 11th level, each time you deal damage to a creature with a Yuki clan Hijutsu, they must make a Constitution saving throw vs your Ninjutsu save DC. On a failed save they gain 1 rank of chilled.

Latent Ice Release IV.name: Latent Ice Release IV
Latent Ice Release IV.description:
(You must have Latent Ice Release III)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain the 11th level effect of the Ice Release clan feature

Latent Immaculate Precision I.name: Latent Immaculate Precision I
Latent Immaculate Precision I.description: Select one weapon between the following; Shuriken, Fuma Shuriken, Monster Shuriken. All Latent features that reference Shuriken, will be referring to the chosen weapon specifically and only apply effects or bonuses to the chosen weapon.

Latent Immaculate Precision II.name: Latent Immaculate Precision II
Latent Immaculate Precision II.description:
(You must have Latent Immaculate Precision II)

You may select a second weapon, that you did not select with your Latent Immaculate Precision I feature.

Latent Immaculate Precision III.name: Latent Immaculate Precision III
Latent Immaculate Precision III.description:
(You must have Latent Immaculate Precision I)

Beginning at 1st level, ranged attacks with shuriken gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls.

Latent Immaculate Precision IV.name: Latent Immaculate Precision IV
Latent Immaculate Precision IV.description:
(You must have Latent Immaculate Precision III)

Beginning at 11st level, ranged attacks with shuriken gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls.

Latent Immaculate Precision V.name: Latent Immaculate Precision V
Latent Immaculate Precision V.description:
(You must have Latent Immaculate Precision IV)

Beginning at 18st level, ranged attacks with shuriken gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls

Latent Immolation.name: Latent Immolation
Latent Immolation.description: Beginning at 15th level, you gain the Immolation clan feature.

Latent Immune System I.name: Latent Immune System I
Latent Immune System I.description:
(You must have Latent Designated Existence)

Beginning at 7th level, you gain resistance to poison damage, and have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of viruses and diseases on your body

Latent Immune System II.name: Latent Immune System II
Latent Immune System II.description:
(You must have Latent Immune System I)

Beginning at 11th level, reduce all Poison damage you receive by -3 (this applies after resistance). Additionally, you always roll at advantage to resist any poison or disease that you've overcome in the past, regardless of the current circumstances.

Latent Immune System III.name: Latent Immune System III
Latent Immune System III.description: (You must have Latent Immune System II) Beginning at 18th level, you can provide antibodies to others to via blood transfusion by spending 1 hit die per creature, granting the affected creature advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of viruses and diseases for 1 hour. You also gain immunity to poison damage and effects caused by poison damage

Latent Inhuman Lifeforce.name: Latent Inhuman Lifeforce
Latent Inhuman Lifeforce.description: Beginning at 15th level, you gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws. If you are already proficiency, you instead gain a +1 bonus to your constitution saving throw bonus.

Latent Inner Chi I.name: Latent Inner Chi I
Latent Inner Chi I.description: You gain a number of Inner Chi equal to your level with a maximum of 10. Inner Chi can be used as chakra for the casting of Taijutsu. You regain spent Inner Chi on a long rest.

Latent Inner Chi II.name: Latent Inner Chi II
Latent Inner Chi II.description:
(You must have Latent Inner Chi I)

Starting at 3rd level, your new Inner Chi is 15. When you would cast a Taijutsu spending a minimum amount of Inner Chi equal to the Taijutsu's Rank (D- Rank: 1, C-Rank: 2, B-Rank: 3, A-Rank: 4, S-Rank: 5), the Taijutsu gains a +1 bonus to damage die (once per casting).

Latent Insect Focus I.name: Latent Insect Focus I
Latent Insect Focus I.description:
You gain a swarm of Nano-Insects. As an Action you can use the following;

Nano-Insect Swarm.

Ranged Ninjutsu Attack, 60 feet range, dealing Xd6 poison damage on a hit. (X = Half your proficiency bonus.)

Latent Insect Focus II.name: Latent Insect Focus II
Latent Insect Focus II.description:
(You must have Latent Insect Focus I).

Beginning at 7th level, your Nano insect Swarm adds half of your proficiency bonus to damage dealt.

Latent Insect Focus III.name: Latent Insect Focus III
Latent Insect Focus III.description:
(You must have Latent Insect Focus II)

Beginning at 15th level, your Nano-Insect Swarm counts as an Aburame Clan jutsu for the purpose of interacting with features that trigger when casting or dealing damage with an Aburame clan jutsu.

Latent Ketsuryūgan I.name: Latent Ketsuryūgan I
Latent Ketsuryūgan I.description: Beginning at 7th level, you have learned how to activate your Ketsuryūgan. As a bonus action, you can spend 10 chakra to activate this latent Dojutsu for 1 minute. While active, you have advantage on rolls to resist the bleeding condition and can change cold damage to deal to necrotic. You can also use any combination of the Ketsuryūgan's action-based abilities a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

Latent Ketsuryūgan II.name: Latent Ketsuryūgan II
Latent Ketsuryūgan II.description:
(You must have Latent Ketsuryūgan I)

Beginning at 11th level, for the duration of your Ketsuryūgan, you become immune to the bleeding condition, and gain resistance to necrotic damage.

Latent Ketsuryūgan III.name: Latent Ketsuryūgan III
Latent Ketsuryūgan III.description:
(You must have Latent Ketsuryūgan II)

Beginning at 18th level, when a creature takes damage from the bleeding condition that was inflicted by you while the Ketsuryūgan is active, they take additional damage equal to their total ranks of bleeding.

Latent Kujaku Mode I.name: Latent Kujaku Mode I
Latent Kujaku Mode I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you gain access to the Kujaku Mode clan feature, but none of its higher level advancements; also your Kujaku Mode gains the benefits of only two listed abilities, and you must choose which upon gaining this latent (this cannot be changed later). You can activate this feature only once per long rest.

Latent Kujaku Mode II.name: Latent Kujaku Mode II
Latent Kujaku Mode II.description:
(You must have Latent Kujaku Mode I )

Beginning at 11th level, you gain any 11th level advancements you may have for your chosen Kujaku Mode abilities. You gain one additional ability of your choice.

Latent Kujaku Mode III.name: Latent Kujaku Mode III
Latent Kujaku Mode III.description:
(You must have Latent Kujaku Mode II )

Beginning at 15th level, you gain any 15th level advancements you may have for your chosen Kujaku Mode benefits. You gain one additional ability of your choice. This feature can now be used twice per long rest.

Latent Kurugan I.name: Latent Kurugan I
Latent Kurugan I.description:
(You must have Latent Yin Chakra Adept I)

Beginning at 7th level, you have learned activate your Kurugan. As an Action you can spend 10 chakra to activate this latent Dojutsu for 1 minute. While active, you gain a +1 bonus to your Wisdom Saving Throws and can use any combination of the Kurgans action-based abilities twice per rest.

Latent Kurugan II.name: Latent Kurugan II
Latent Kurugan II.description:
(You must have Latent Kurugan I)

Beginning at 11th level, when you would activate your Kurugan, you can choose to also spend 1 chakra die. If you do, you can also cast the Pierce the Veil Kuru clan Hijutsu as part of its activation without having the jutsu on your known jutsu list.

Latent Kurugan III.name: Latent Kurugan III
Latent Kurugan III.description:
(You must have Latent Kurugan II)

Beginning at 15th level, increase the number of times you can use the Kurugan's action-based abilities per rest to four times.

Latent Lava Release I.name: Latent Lava Release I
Latent Lava Release I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, jutsu you cast with the Earth Release or Fire Release keyword that you cast grants you 3 DR until the beginning of your next turn against the first instance of damage you take.

Latent Lava Release II.name: Latent Lava Release II
Latent Lava Release II.description:
(You must have Latent Lava Release I)

Beginning at 15th level, the Damage reduction is increased to 10 DR

Latent Lava Release III.name: Latent Lava Release III
Latent Lava Release III.description:
(You must have Latent Lava Release I)

Beginning at 11th level, select two qualities from the Lava Release clan feature. You can inflict these qualities on a creature you did damage to with a Ninjutsu or Hijutsu with the Earth release keyword. You can do this twice per long rest.

Latent Lava Release IV.name: Latent Lava Release IV
Latent Lava Release IV.description:
(You must have Latent Lava Release III)

Beginning at 18th level, you can use the chosen qualities 2 additional times per long rest.

Latent Lethal Precision I.name: Latent Lethal Precision I
Latent Lethal Precision I.description:
(You must have Latent Immaculate Precision I)

Beginning at 11th level, you critical threat range with your shuriken is increased by +1.

Latent Lightning Release Adept I.name: Latent Lightning Release Adept I
Latent Lightning Release Adept I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, reduce the cost of jutsu with the Lightning Release keyword of D-Rank or higher, by 1. This counts as Rank based reduction.

Latent Lightning Release Adept II.name: Latent Lightning Release Adept II
Latent Lightning Release Adept II.description:
(You must have Latent Lightning Release Adept I)

Beginning at 15th level, jutsu with the Lightning Release keyword of C-Rank or higher cost is instead reduced by 2. This counts as Rank based reduction.

Latent Lightning Release Adept III.name: Latent Lightning Release Adept III
Latent Lightning Release Adept III.description:
(You must have Latent Advanced Chakra Control II & Latent White Chakra I)

Beginning at 11th level, When you would cast a jutsu with the Lightning Release Keyword and an Overcharge effect, you can choose to spend an amount of White Chakra equal to its rank to fulfill the Overcharge requirements to gain their effects. (D-Rank/C-Rank: 1 White Chakra (WC), B-Rank/A-Rank: 2 WC, S-Rank: 3 WC)

Latent Lightning Release Inability.name: Latent Lightning Release Inability
Latent Lightning Release Inability.description: You cannot learn or cast Ninjutsu with the Lightning Release Keyword. If the jutsu cast has the Hijutsu keyword, you can learn or cast the jutsu as normal.

Latent Made of Water I.name: Latent Made of Water I
Latent Made of Water I.description:
(You must have Latent Lightning Release Inability)

Beginning at 3rd level your body counts as a sufficient source of water to reduce the cost of Water release jutsu. You cannot gain the alternative effect of a Water release jutsu using this feature. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

Latent Made of Water II.name: Latent Made of Water II
Latent Made of Water II.description:
(You must have Latent Made of Water I)

You can use Latent Made of Water I, effect a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per short rest.

Latent Magnet Release I.name: Latent Magnet Release I
Latent Magnet Release I.description: Beginning at 3rd level if you would cast a jutsu with the Earth Release or Wind Release keywords, you can, you deal a bonus damage die to creatures who's movement speed is currently 0.

Latent Magnet Release II.name: Latent Magnet Release II
Latent Magnet Release II.description: (You must have Latent Magnet Release I) Beginning at 15th level, Earth or Wind Release keywords you cast increases your AC by 1d4 until the beginning of your next turn, up to twice per rest.

Latent Magnetic Mark I.name: Latent Magnetic Mark I
Latent Magnetic Mark I.description:
(You must have D-Rank Hijutsu)

Beginning at 11th level, when you would deal damage or affected a hostile with a Jiton Hijutsu, that creature is marked until the end of your next turn. You are always aware of a marked creatures location and they cannot benefit from being hidden from you.

Latent Magnetic Mark II.name: Latent Magnetic Mark II
Latent Magnetic Mark II.description:
(You must have Latent Magnetic Mark I)

Beginning at 15th level, If a marked creature hits you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can spend 10 chakra, reducing the targets attack result by -3.

Latent Master Mental Alteration.name: Latent Master Mental Alteration
Latent Master Mental Alteration.description: Beginning at 15th level, you gain the Master Mental Alteration clan feature.

Latent Master of Shadows I.name: Latent Master of Shadows I
Latent Master of Shadows I.description:
(You must have D-Rank Hijutsu)

Beginning at 11th level, if you would restrain a creature using a Nara Hijutsu, while that creature is in bright light, increase the DC by 1. If you have a passive bonus to your Hijutsu's save DC as a result of class feature you have to decide which bonus you want. They do not stack.

Latent Master of Shadows II.name: Latent Master of Shadows II
Latent Master of Shadows II.description:
(You must have Master of Shadows I1)

Beginning at 18th level, the bonus to restrain a creature in bright light, increases by +1.

Latent Master Tactician I.name: Latent Master Tactician I
Latent Master Tactician I.description: Beginning at 7th level, once per turn, as a bonus action, you can provide one allied creature a tactical die (D4). They can use this die and add it to any one attack roll, skill check or saving throw. This die lasts for 1 hour and an ally can only have one tactical die at a time. You can provide tactical die in this way twice per long rest.

Latent Master Tactician II.name: Latent Master Tactician II
Latent Master Tactician II.description:
(You must have Latent Master Tactician I)

Beginning at 15th level, the die size increases to a d6.

Latent Medical Fist I.name: Latent Medical Fist I
Latent Medical Fist I.description: Beginning at 1st level, you gain access to the Medical Fist Stance. While in this stance, jutsu you gain that deal your unarmed damage gain a +10ft bonus to range, and deal 1.5x damage to structures. Also, your [Unarmed Damage Die] becomes a 1d6.

Latent Medical Fist II.name: Latent Medical Fist II
Latent Medical Fist II.description:
(You must have Latent Medical Fist I)

At 3rd level, while in the Medical Fist Stance, Ninjutsu you cast with the medical keyword that makes a melee attack roll, you may treat Strength as your casting modifier for attack and damage rolls (Not Save DC). When cast this way, melee Ninjutsu attacks made count as Melee Taijutsu attacks and add your [Unarmed Damage] to the jutsu's first damage roll.

Latent Medical Fist III.name: Latent Medical Fist III
Latent Medical Fist III.description:
(You must have Latent Medical Fist II)

At 7th level, your bonus to range from the Medical Fist Stance becomes +15ft, and you gain a bonus to concentration checks to maintain concentration of Taijutsu with the Medical keyword equal to half your Strength modifier, rounded up.

Latent Medical Fist IV.name: Latent Medical Fist IV
Latent Medical Fist IV.description:
(You must have Latent Medical Fist III)

At 11th level, your bonus to range from the Medical Fist Stance becomes +20ft, and once per round when you would cast a Taijutsu or jutsu with the Medical keyword that makes an attack, you can make one unarmed attack as part of the casting.

Latent Mental Boon I.name: Latent Mental Boon I
Latent Mental Boon I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you gain 1 Mental boon of your choice from the Yamanaka Boons table, that you qualify for.

Latent Mental Boon II.name: Latent Mental Boon II
Latent Mental Boon II.description:
(You must have Latent Mental Boon I)

Beginning at 11th level, you gain a second Mental boon, of which you qualify for.

Latent Mental Boon III.name: Latent Mental Boon III
Latent Mental Boon III.description:
(You must have Latent Mental Boon II)

Beginning at 18th level, you gain a third Mental boon, of which you qualify for.

Latent Mental Clarity I.name: Latent Mental Clarity I
Latent Mental Clarity I.description: Beginning at 11th level, you gain a 1d4 bonus to saving throws against Genjutsu with the Unaware keyword.

Latent Mental Clarity II.name: Latent Mental Clarity II
Latent Mental Clarity II.description:
You must have Latent Mental Clarity I)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain a 1d4 bonus to insight checks against creatures attempting to lie to you

Latent Mental Clarity III.name: Latent Mental Clarity III
Latent Mental Clarity III.description:
(You must have Latent Mental Clarity II)

Beginning at 18th level, as a bonus action you can target one creature you can see within 60 feet and make a Wisdom or Charisma (insight) check vs a DC 10 + their level. On a success, you learn the targets Wisdom or Charisma score. You can do this twice per long rest

Latent Mitotic Regeneration I.name: Latent Mitotic Regeneration I
Latent Mitotic Regeneration I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you learn to manifest a pool of Latent Senju Cells. You gain a number of Senju Cells equal to your level, up to a maximum of 5 Senju Cells which can only be spent as a Bonus action on your turn, to regain 1d6 + Constitution in hit points per cell spent.

Latent Mitotic Regeneration II.name: Latent Mitotic Regeneration II
Latent Mitotic Regeneration II.description: Beginning at 11th level, your maximum number of Senju Cells increases to 10.

Latent Monkeys Paw I.name: Latent Monkeys Paw I
Latent Monkeys Paw I.description: Starting at 1st level, a number of times equal to your Taijutsu ability modifier per long rest, you may add a +1d4 bonus to any Strength or Dexterity skill check.

Latent Monkeys Paw II.name: Latent Monkeys Paw II
Latent Monkeys Paw II.description:
(You must have Latent Monkeys Paw I)

Starting at the 7th level the die for Latent Monkeys Paw becomes a +1d6.

Latent Monkeys Paw III.name: Latent Monkeys Paw III
Latent Monkeys Paw III.description:
(You must have Latent Monkeys Paw II)

Beginning at 15th level, the die for Latent Monkey's Paw becomes a +1d8. You also recover half your expended uses of this feature on a short rest

Latent One with Earth.name: Latent One with Earth
Latent One with Earth.description: Beginning at 7th level, You may use Charisma as your Ninjutsu ability modifier for Ninjutsu with the Earth Release Keyword

Latent Onijutsu I.name: Latent Onijutsu I
Latent Onijutsu I.description: Beginning at 7th level, you gain a number of Onijutsu coils equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest. You can spend 1 coil to use any Onijutsu you have. Select two Onijutsu which you can use with this feature.

Latent Onijutsu II.name: Latent Onijutsu II
Latent Onijutsu II.description:
(You must have Latent Onijutsu I)

Beginning at 11th level, select one more Onijutsu to learn.

Latent Onijutsu III.name: Latent Onijutsu III
Latent Onijutsu III.description:
(You must have Latent Onijutsu II)

Beginning at 18th level, select one more Onijutsu to learn.

Latent Overloaded Regeneration.name: Latent Overloaded Regeneration
Latent Overloaded Regeneration.description:
(You must have Latent Medical Fist I)

Beginning at 18th level, while in the Medical Fist Stance, when you cast a Taijutsu, you may immediately cast a Medical Jutsu that restores hit points on yourself as part of the same action

Latent Paper Expert I.name: Latent Paper Expert I
Latent Paper Expert I.description: Beginning at 7th level, the DC of explosive tools become equal to your Ninjutsu save DC if your Ninjutsu save DC would be higher than the Ninja tools save DC.

Latent Paper Expert II.name: Latent Paper Expert II
Latent Paper Expert II.description:
You must have Latent Paper Expert I)

Beginning at 11th level, whenever you would use an explosive tool, by spending 10 chakra, you gain the Bonus Damage effect of the Paper Expert clan feature.

Latent Paper Reservoir I.name: Latent Paper Reservoir I
Latent Paper Reservoir I.description: Beginning at 11th level, you may reduce the cost of jutsu with the Chakra Seal component (CS), by 1.

Latent Paper Reservoir II.name: Latent Paper Reservoir II
Latent Paper Reservoir II.description: Beginning at 18th level, the cost reduction increases to -2.

Latent Papercraft I.name: Latent Papercraft I
Latent Papercraft I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, whenever you would gain the benefit of a short or long rest, you gain the benefit of the Papercraft clan feature.

Latent Perfected Creation.name: Latent Perfected Creation
Latent Perfected Creation.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you gain the Perfected Creation feature of the Konjiki Clan, as if you were 3rd level.

Latent Plasma Release I.name: Latent Plasma Release I
Latent Plasma Release I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, when you cast a jutsu with the Fire or Lightning Release keyword, you can choose to emit 15 feet of bright light and 30 feet of dim light until the start of your next turn. This light dispels chakra enhanced darkness. You can use this feature twice per rest

Latent Plasma Release II.name: Latent Plasma Release II
Latent Plasma Release II.description:
(You must have Latent Plasma Release I)

Beginning at 15th level, you can use this feature three times per rest.

Latent Plasma Release III.name: Latent Plasma Release III
Latent Plasma Release III.description:
(You must have Latent Plasma Release I)

Beginning at 7th level, select one between Fire Release or Lightning Release. When casting a jutsu with the chosen nature release, reduce its cost by 1 (min. 1)

Latent Poison Potency I.name: Latent Poison Potency I
Latent Poison Potency I.description: Beginning at 7th level, twice per long rest, as a bonus action, you can coat your weapon in a viper's venom. For the next minute, your weapons damage type becomes poison and your weapon deals a bonus +2 damage. This increases to a +3 at 18th level

Latent Poison Potency II.name: Latent Poison Potency II
Latent Poison Potency II.description:
(You must have Latent Poison Potency I)

Beginning at 15th level, once per turn, when you would deal 20 or more poison damage to a creature with a weapon coated with vipers' venom, they must make a Constitution Save vs your Taijutsu Save DC, on a failed save the affected creature reduces all hit points gained by half, until the end of their next turn.

Latent Precise Performance.name: Latent Precise Performance
Latent Precise Performance.description: Starting at 7th level, when you would cast a Genjutsu that does not have the Auditory keyword, you can spend increments of 3 chakra to remove one sensory keyword from the genjutsu, excluding the tactile keyword. If you remove all other sensory keywords this way, the jutsu gains the Auditory keyword.

Latent Raging Tempest I.name: Latent Raging Tempest I
Latent Raging Tempest I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, when you would cast a Ninjutsu with the Wind Release Keyword, that has an area of effect, you may increase the area by 5 feet in every direction.

Latent Raging Tempest II.name: Latent Raging Tempest II
Latent Raging Tempest II.description:
(You must have Latent Raging Tempest I)

Beginning at 18th level this increases by an additional 10 feet and the range of the jutsu increases by 30 feet.

Latent Ravenous Chakra I.name: Latent Ravenous Chakra I
Latent Ravenous Chakra I.description: Beginning at 7th level, when you cast a jutsu with the water release keyword that deals damage also deals Chakra damage equal to half the result. You can do this twice per long rest.

Latent Ravenous Chakra II.name: Latent Ravenous Chakra II
Latent Ravenous Chakra II.description:
(You must have Latent Ravenous Chakra I)

Beginning at 11th level, when you would deal chakra damage as a result of Latent Ravenous Chakra I, you also gain temporary chakra points equal to half of the chakra damage dealt

Latent Raw Chakra Form I.name: Latent Raw Chakra Form I
Latent Raw Chakra Form I.description:
(You must have Latent Raw Chakra I)

Beginning at 7th level you can enter your Raw Chakra Form. Entering this form costs an action and you can enter this form once per long rest for 1 minute. While in this form, you gain all the abilities of the Raw Chakra Form clan feature as if you were 3rd level.

Latent Raw Chakra Form II.name: Latent Raw Chakra Form II
Latent Raw Chakra Form II.description:
(You must have Latent Raw Chakra Form I)

Beginning at 15th level you gain all the abilities of the Raw Chakra Form clan feature as if you were 7th level.

Latent Raw Chakra Form III.name: Latent Raw Chakra Form III
Latent Raw Chakra Form III.description:
(You must have Latent Raw Chakra Form II)

Beginning at 15th level you can enter the form an additional time per long rest.

Latent Raw Chakra I.name: Latent Raw Chakra I
Latent Raw Chakra I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you gain 2 Raw chakra dice, which are d4's. You regain spent Raw chakra dice on a long rest. Select 2 Raw chakra effects from the Raw Chakra Jugo clan feature that you can spend your raw chakra on. You cannot change this selection later.

Latent Raw Chakra II.name: Latent Raw Chakra II
Latent Raw Chakra II.description:
(You must have Latent Raw Chakra I)

Beginning at 11th level, you gain 2 additional Raw chakra dice

Latent Raw Chakra III.name: Latent Raw Chakra III
Latent Raw Chakra III.description:
(You must have Latent Raw Chakra I)

Beginning at 11th level, you can select one additional Raw chakra effect from the Raw Chakra Jugo clan feature

Latent Raw Chakra IV.name: Latent Raw Chakra IV
Latent Raw Chakra IV.description:
(You must have Latent Raw Chakra II)

Beginning at 18th level, you gain 2 additional Raw chakra dice.

Latent Raw Chakra V.name: Latent Raw Chakra V
Latent Raw Chakra V.description:
(You must have Latent Raw Chakra III)

Beginning at 18th level, you gain the final Raw chakra effect from the Raw Chakra Jugo clan feature that you did not select before.

Latent Razor-Sharp Senses I.name: Latent Razor-Sharp Senses I
Latent Razor-Sharp Senses I.description:
(You must have Latent Immaculate Precision I)

Beginning at 3rd level, once per long rest, when you would miss a weapon or Taijutsu attack with a shuriken or where a shuriken was used as a component, you can remake the roll, taking the second result.

Latent Razor-Sharp Senses II.name: Latent Razor-Sharp Senses II
Latent Razor-Sharp Senses II.description:
(You must have Latent Razor-Sharp Senses I)

Beginning at 11rd level, you can now remake the attack roll, twice per long rest.

Latent Reckless Genjutsu.name: Latent Reckless Genjutsu
Latent Reckless Genjutsu.description: Beginning at 11th level, as long as you are equipped with your Auditory Ninja Tool, when you would cast a genjutsu with the auditory keyword that does damage and requires a saving throw you can reduce your Save DC by 1, up to 3 times and increase the amount of damage die the genjutsu has by the same amount

Latent Reflective Surface.name: Latent Reflective Surface
Latent Reflective Surface.description:
(You must have Latent Lightning Release Inability)

Beginning at 18th level, whenever you cast a Ninjutsu with the Water Release keyword, you gain temporary hit points equal to the rank of the jutsu used. (D-Rank: 5, C-Rank: 10, B-Rank: 15, A-Rank: 20, S-Rank: 25)

Latent Regeneration I.name: Latent Regeneration I
Latent Regeneration I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, you learn to slowly regenerate from damage. As a Bonus Action, you can regain 2d4 Hit Points. You can regain hit points in this way twice per rest.

Latent Regeneration II.name: Latent Regeneration II
Latent Regeneration II.description:
(You must have Latent Regeneration I)

Beginning at 7th level, you gain advantage against the Poisoned condition.

Latent Regeneration III.name: Latent Regeneration III
Latent Regeneration III.description:
(You must have Latent Regeneration II)

Beginning at 11th level, increase the Hit Points regained to 3d6.

Latent Regeneration IV.name: Latent Regeneration IV
Latent Regeneration IV.description:
(You must have Latent Regeneration III)

Beginning at 18th level, increase the number of Hit Points recovered to 3d8 + half your level.

Latent Reinforced and Pressurized I.name: Latent Reinforced and Pressurized I
Latent Reinforced and Pressurized I.description: Beginning at 11th level, when you cast a jutsu with the Earth Release keyword that creates a construct or gives Temporary Hit Points, the construct or the target creature gains an additional amount of Temp Hit Points or Hit Points equal to your proficiency bonus.

Latent Reinforced and Pressurized II.name: Latent Reinforced and Pressurized II
Latent Reinforced and Pressurized II.description:
(You must have Latent Reinforced and Pressurized I)

Beginning at 15th level you instead add half your character level, and constructs created with the Earth Release keyword lose any vulnerabilities/inabilities to defend against Lightning Damage.

Latent Reinforced and Pressurized III.name: Latent Reinforced and Pressurized III
Latent Reinforced and Pressurized III.description:
(You must have Latent Reinforced and Pressurized II)

Beginning at 18th level you instead add your full character level, and constructs created with the Earth Release keyword lose any vulnerabilities/inabilities to defend against Genjutsu

Latent Rock-Hard Stability I.name: Latent Rock-Hard Stability I
Latent Rock-Hard Stability I.description: Beginning at 7th level, while you are maintaining concentration on a ninjutsu with the Earth Release keyword, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC.

Latent Rock-Hard Stability II.name: Latent Rock-Hard Stability II
Latent Rock-Hard Stability II.description:
(You must have Latent Rock-hard Stability I)

Beginning at 15th level, your bonus to AC increase to a +2.

Latent Sacred Body.name: Latent Sacred Body
Latent Sacred Body.description:
(You must have D-Rank Hijutsu)

Beginning at 7rd level, you can use Constitution as your Ninjutsu ability modifier for Senju Hijutsu you cast.

Latent Sanguine Prowess I.name: Latent Sanguine Prowess I
Latent Sanguine Prowess I.description: Beginning at 1st level, when you cast a jutsu with the Water Release keyword, you can sacrifice 1d6 hit points as part of casting the jutsu to give the jutsu the benefits it would receive for being near a sufficient source of water. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest

Latent Sanguine Prowess II.name: Latent Sanguine Prowess II
Latent Sanguine Prowess II.description:
(You must have Latent Sanguine Prowess II)

Beginning at 1st level, when this feature is used if the jutsu cast does not gain any benefits for being near a sufficient source of water, reduce the cost of the jutsu by -1 (Min.1).

Latent Sanguine Prowess III.name: Latent Sanguine Prowess III
Latent Sanguine Prowess III.description:
(You must have Latent Sanguine Prowess II)

Beginning at 7th level, when you use this feature, your jutsu gains one of the following benefits, once per casting: +1 to damage die. +1 to healing die. +1 to Save DC.

Latent Sanguine Prowess IV.name: Latent Sanguine Prowess IV
Latent Sanguine Prowess IV.description:
(You must have Latent Sanguine Prowess III)

Beginning at 7th level, uses of this feature now reset on a short rest, and if you cast a jutsu that does gain any special benefits for being near a sufficient source of water, reduce the cost of the jutsu by -2 (Min. 1), instead of -1.

Latent Sanguine Prowess V.name: Latent Sanguine Prowess V
Latent Sanguine Prowess V.description:
(You must have Latent Sanguine Prowess IV)

Beginning at 15th level, when you use this feature, you can select an additional benefit for your jutsu. You cannot select the same benefit twice

Latent Savage Attack I.name: Latent Savage Attack I
Latent Savage Attack I.description:
(You must have Latent Beast Master I)

Beginning at 7th level, when you and your Nin-Dog are on opposite sides of a creature, the first attack either of you makes each turn is at advantage.

Latent Savage Attack II.name: Latent Savage Attack II
Latent Savage Attack II.description:
(You must have Latent Savage Attack I)

Beginning at 11th level, when either yourself or your Nin-Dog scores a critical hit, you deal an additional die of damage

Latent Savage Attack III.name: Latent Savage Attack III
Latent Savage Attack III.description:
(You must have Latent Savage Attack II)

Beginning at 18th level, when either yourself or your Nin-Dog deals damage to a creature under 50% of its maximum hit points, with an unarmed attack, weapon attack or Inuzuka clan Hijutsu, increase the damage die by 1 step.

Latent Scorch Release I.name: Latent Scorch Release I
Latent Scorch Release I.description: Beginning at 3rd level, jutsu you cast with the Wind Release or Fire Release keywords deals +3 additional fire damage to creatures with the burned condition, once per casting.

Latent Scorch Release II.name: Latent Scorch Release II
Latent Scorch Release II.description:
(You must have Latent Scorch Release I)

Beginning at 15th level, bonus damage is increased to +5.

Latent Scorch Release III.name: Latent Scorch Release III
Latent Scorch Release III.description:
(You must have Latent Scorch Release I)

Beginning at 11th level, a creature whom you inflicted with ranks of burned, gains 1 rank of weakened for the duration.

Latent Scorch Release IV.name: Latent Scorch Release IV
Latent Scorch Release IV.description:
(You must have Latent Scorch Release III)

Beginning at 18th level, creatures whom you inflicted with ranks of burned suffers a -5 penalty to ending the condition.

Latent Scorching Heat I.name: Latent Scorching Heat I
Latent Scorching Heat I.description: Beginning at 7rd level, you gain 3 Scorch Die (d4). You can spend Scorch Die when you would deal fire damage, adding the result to the damage dealt, and also ignoring resistances. You regain spent Scorch Die when you would complete a long rest.

Latent Scorching Heat II.name: Latent Scorching Heat II
Latent Scorching Heat II.description:
(You must have Scorching Heat I)

Beginning at 11th level, You can spend Scorch Die to reduce a single creatures saving throw by half the result.

Latent Scorching Heat III.name: Latent Scorching Heat III
Latent Scorching Heat III.description:
(You must have Scorching Heat II)

Beginning at 15rd level, you gain 2 additional Scorch Die

Latent Serpent Mimicry I.name: Latent Serpent Mimicry I
Latent Serpent Mimicry I.description: Beginning at 1st level, you have either 60 feet of Darkvision or 30 feet of Tremorsense, pick one.

Latent Serpent Mimicry II.name: Latent Serpent Mimicry II
Latent Serpent Mimicry II.description:
(You must have Latent Serpent Mimicry I)

Beginning at 7th level, you gain the second special sense you didn't select from Latent Serpent Mimicry.

Latent Serpent Mimicry III.name: Latent Serpent Mimicry III
Latent Serpent Mimicry III.description:
(You must have Latent Serpent Mimicry II)

Beginning at 15th level, you have advantage on Stealth Checks made in natural environments such as forests, woods, and tundra's

Latent Sharingan I.name: Latent Sharingan I
Latent Sharingan I.description: Beginning at 7th level, you gain the 1 Tomoe Sharingan. You can activate this Sharingan as a Bonus action and by spending 10 chakra. You may use abilities granted by your Sharingan twice per activation. You may spend 10 chakra while your Sharingan is active to reset the number of ability uses you have. Select one ability from the 1-Tomoe Sharingan list.

Latent Sharingan II.name: Latent Sharingan II
Latent Sharingan II.description:
(You must have Latent Sharingan I)

Beginning at 11th level, you gain the 2-Tomoe Sharingan.

While your Sharingan is active, you gain 30-feet of Chakra sight and a second ability from the 1-Tomoe Sharingan list.

Latent Sharingan III.name: Latent Sharingan III
Latent Sharingan III.description:
(You must have Latent Sharingan II)

Beginning at 15th level, you gain the 3-Tomoe Sharingan. While your Sharingan is active, you can perform the Search action as a bonus action and a one ability from the 2-Tomoe Sharingan list.

Latent Sharingan IV.name: Latent Sharingan IV
Latent Sharingan IV.description:
(You must have Latent Sharingan III)

Beginning at 18th level, Select one Sharingan ability from any of the Tomoe lists that you quality for.

Latent Shark Skinned Predator.name: Latent Shark Skinned Predator
Latent Shark Skinned Predator.description: Beginning at 15th level, you can transform into a shark like form gaining the benefits of the Shark Skinned Predator Hoshigaki clan feature as if you were an 11th level Hoshigaki. You do not gain the ability to use your Constitution instead of Dexterity to calculate your Armor Class. You can transform in this way once per long rest.

Latent Sharpened Edge.name: Latent Sharpened Edge
Latent Sharpened Edge.description: Beginning at 11th level, you gain the Sharpened Edge feature from the Yamada clan. This feature can only make die explode up two times per round, as opposed to per instance of damage.

Latent Shikotsumyaku Stance I.name: Latent Shikotsumyaku Stance I
Latent Shikotsumyaku Stance I.description:
(You must have Latent Bone Weapons I & D-Rank Hijutsu)

Beginning at 3rd level, you can use Dexterity in place of Strength for Bone weapon attacks and D-Rank Kaguya clan Hijutsu.

Latent Shikotsumyaku Stance II.name: Latent Shikotsumyaku Stance II
Latent Shikotsumyaku Stance II.description:
(You must have Latent Shikotsumyaku Stance I)

Beginning at 11th level, when you make a Taijutsu attack as a result of a Kaguya Clan Bukijutsu, your AC increases by +1 for each hostile creature within 10 feet of you, up to a maximum of +2, until the beginning of your next turn.

Latent Shocking Wave I.name: Latent Shocking Wave I
Latent Shocking Wave I.description:
(You must have D-Rank Hijutsu)

Beginning at 7th level, when you would deal lightning damage with a Ranton clan Hijutsu to a creature who are under the effects of or have taken damage from a jutsu with the water release keyword, you deal an additional 1d6 lightning damage.

Latent Shocking Wave II.name: Latent Shocking Wave II
Latent Shocking Wave II.description:
(You must have Latent Shocking Wave I)

Beginning at 15th level, the bonus damage dealt increases to 2d6.

Latent Shuriken Master I.name: Latent Shuriken Master I
Latent Shuriken Master I.description:
(You must have Latent Immaculate Precision I)

Beginning at 11th level, you add 1d4 to your shuriken's damage. This bonus damage is always treated as part of the weapons damage die.

Latent Shuriken Master II.name: Latent Shuriken Master II
Latent Shuriken Master II.description:
(You must have Latent Shuriken Master I)

Beginning at 18th level, the bonus damage increases to a d6.

Latent Single- Swing Style I.name: Latent Single- Swing Style I
Latent Single- Swing Style I.description: Starting at 7th level, if you have a feature that allows you to make multiple attacks you can choose to instead make a single attack, dealing the damage from all attacks. Any bonuses to critical hit damage are only added once (Ex. Critical Feats, the Deadly property, etc)

Latent Single- Swing Style II.name: Latent Single- Swing Style II
Latent Single- Swing Style II.description:
(You must have Latent Single-Swing Style I)

At 15th level, when you cast a Bukijutsu that uses a Katana or Odachi that has multiple attacks, you may choose to instead make one attack and deal the damage from all attacks. If you score a critical hit while using this feature, you only double the damage dice from what would have been the first attack.

Latent Single- Swing Style III.name: Latent Single- Swing Style III
Latent Single- Swing Style III.description:
(You must have Latent Single-Swing Style II)

At 18th level, when you cast a Bukijutsu with the finisher keyword, you may spend 10 additional chakra to treat the jutsu as a finisher, even if it was not cast after a combo jutsu

Latent Smoke Aberration I.name: Latent Smoke Aberration I
Latent Smoke Aberration I.description: Beginning at 7th level, as a bonus action after casting a jutsu with the Fire Release keyword, you can morph yourself to smoke and move to a space within 10 feet without provoking an attack of opportunity. You can also spend 5 chakra after casting a jutsu with the Fire Release keyword to use this feature without spending a bonus action. You can benefit from this feature once per round.

Latent Smoke Aberration II.name: Latent Smoke Aberration II
Latent Smoke Aberration II.description:
(You must have Latent Smoke Aberration I)

Beginning at 18th level, when you use this feature, your AC increases by +1 until the start of your next turn.

Latent Smoke Release I.name: Latent Smoke Release I
Latent Smoke Release I.description: Beginning at 7th level, when you cast a jutsu with the Fire Release keyword, you can change the damage type to fire, and impose a -2 penalty on the first saving throw one affected creature makes against your jutsu or your Will-O-Wisps feature, if you have it.

Latent Smoke Release II.name: Latent Smoke Release II
Latent Smoke Release II.description:
(You must have Latent Smoke Release I)

Beginning at 15th level, once per rest, when you cast a jutsu with the Fire Release keyword, you can blind all affected creatures until the end of each of their turns.

Latent Soft Physique Modification I.name: Latent Soft Physique Modification I
Latent Soft Physique Modification I.description:
(You must have Latent Designated Existence)

Beginning at 1st level, you can spend 2 chakra to dislocate your body's joints and extend them up to 15 feet away. You can do this at any point during combat (no action required). While benefitting from this feature, your unarmed attack range is 15 feet, and you have advantage on grappling checks (can use Acrobatics instead of Athletics for grappling). However, while benefitting from this feature, you cannot use a weapon, Taijutsu attack rolls you make are at disadvantage, and you cannot benefit from any stances. You can end this feature at any point on your turn.

Latent Soft Physique Modification II.name: Latent Soft Physique Modification II
Latent Soft Physique Modification II.description:
(You must have Latent Soft Physique Modification I)

Beginning at 11th level, you increase the range provided by this feature to 20 feet.

Latent Star Chakra I.name: Latent Star Chakra I
Latent Star Chakra I.description: Beginning at 1st level, you have a pool of Star Chakra equal to half your Con mod + half level to a max total of 5 which can be used in place of regular chakra to fuel jutsu or features Your Star Chakra pool replenishes after a long rest. Star Chakra cannot be absorbed, damaged, or reduced by hostile effects. Jutsu cast using any amount of Star Chakra cannot be dispelled by a rank equal to or less than the jutsu cast.

Latent Star Chakra II.name: Latent Star Chakra II
Latent Star Chakra II.description:
(You must have Latent Star Chakra I )

Your pool of Star Chakra is equal to your Con mod + your level. To a max total of 10 Star Chakra.

Latent Star Chakra III.name: Latent Star Chakra III
